page.title: 14QUERNMORE WATER PROJECT 2
page.content: When the tunnel was being built the men used a large,round cylinder made from metal,this was to protect them.As they went deeper under the ground they came to rocks of millstone grit.They drilled holes in these and then put in explosives and blew them up,this is called blasting. While this was going on at the Quernmore end workmen were doing the same thing at Abbeystead and they met in the middle.The whole scheme cost 60 million pounds and took three years to complete. It was offically opened by the Queen in 1980 and all the local children were invited to go and watch. We went to Quernmore Park and had a very good view, it was an exciting day.
